data.what_is:
Shape is purpose-built sales and marketing automation software that comes with pre-built features that can be configured for any business. The easy-to-use interface empowers your teams and consolidates all aspects of your business in one AI platform.

Shape Software provides a collaborative space for your teams to stay aligned and efficient in everything they do, whether it's streamlining your sales pipeline, engaging more prospects with marketing sequences and digital ads, nurturing customer relationships, communicating seamlessly, or tracking projects.

Start growing your revenue with Shape today.
data.product_description: Shape's universal platform connects your team, applications, and clients in one centralized hub. Streamline everyday tasks with an intuitive, industry-specific workflow. Build trust with personalized email, video, and sms campaigns that close more deals. Send perfectly timed follow ups & automatic reminders to your warmest leads to seal the deal.

pricing_plans.plan_description: With Shape, you don't need to decide between different product offerings. Most of our features are included in one system for an affordable month-to-month price.

initial_reviews.review_title: Has potential, went another direction
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Shape Software?
Shape appeared to be well designed and had several advanced features like email marketing, lead scoring, and a customer portal. We signed up for 1 month and decided it was not the right fit for us.

What do you dislike about Shape Software?
We often found ourselves knowing more about their product than the Shape sales rep. CRM was not very customizable - you are limited to 20 custom fields and they are hidden in a separate tab. CRM was a little slower than our prior CRM, would take an extra second or two to load. Pricing is also more expensive than some of their competitors and their are several additional costs - storage costs, API costs, etc. Their API is also pretty limiting, both in the functionality it offers and the low daily/hourly rate limits which is surprising considering you have to pay an extra monthly fee to use their API.

What problems is Shape Software solving and how is that benefiting you?
We were looking for a CRM to handle inbound sales leads.

initial_reviews.review_title: RIP - OFF WITH HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Shape Software?
cloud based. Nothing really other then centralizing lead info and docs into one convenient portal

What do you dislike about Shape Software?
The company has been billing us month after month for services we did not enable. $300 / mo for google API for maps and $500 / month for call recording. Do not be fooled by their 99/month advertisement. The system will not allow us to remove our credit card info, and they have yet to refund us for fraudulent billing charges that have occurred month after month. They never pick up the phone and bounce you around to different departments via email ONLY. When I emailed my notification of canceling, service was the only time I received a phone call regarding the matter from Daniel Kim in an attempt to retain our account, which is sadly too late. Given the company's evil actions, I am looking to see who else out there has been taken advantage of by Shape. My attorney would like others to step forward so we can build a cohesive case and seek damages for all who are entitled.

Also, any changes, even if it is of the smallest type, have to go through their "engineers," so you have to pay a premium to make any alternations handicapping you and your IT/web development staff.  Please stay away from this company and go with a more established organization.

What problems is Shape Software solving and how is that benefiting you?
Centralizing lead/prospect info with their respective documents is the only real benefit we have experienced; we still pay for a dialer system and store all of the borrowers' documents in the operating loan system.

initial_reviews.review_title: 10 out of 10 Prospecting and Contact Management Software
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Shape Software?
Prospecting, organization, project management, and reporting is fantastic with Shape.  I've worked on teams where I managed many people under me before, and I still work with an amazing team of people but after properly configuring Shape I'm able to get as much done with just me + Shape's automation as I've been able to do with many assistants before.

Prospecting: We can import massive lists of prospects and we run e-mail text and phone campaigns with all prospects automatically.  We can easily take notes after each contact or contact attempt (I don't even type I just use their voicenote feature) and best of all there are automated e-mails and texts that go out after each contact attempt.  For example after a call if a prospect doesn't answer an automatic e-mail and text is sent out from my system.  There's also a voicemail drop feature which saves us hours, anytime I call and someone doesn't answer I just push a button and a voicemail is left for them.
Organization: My calendar is synced, their mobile app notifies me of everything, and the task management and project management features allow me and everyone to work out of one centralized place.
Reporting: It looks like there are 100+ pre-built reports but I honestly have no idea how many there are (we just use the call reports and email reports, we don't really use the others yet).

My favorite thing, which probably isn't a big deal, is their call recording feature.  Instead of pipeline reports where we used to have to describe what someone sounded like on the phone I can simply just play a recording to hear the candidate speak.

What do you dislike about Shape Software?
I'm talking to them to see if I can build out some customized features and I'm pretty hopeful I can use their client portal and if that's the case then GEM and other softwares like greenhouse, lever, or Asana may not even be needed in the future and we can just use Shape for those similar features if needed again.

What problems is Shape Software solving and how is that benefiting you?
Sourcing, prospecting, follow-up automation.  I mentioned the call recording feature which I loved and thankfully we didn't even need to purchase Ytel or Ringcentral we just use Shape!

review_question_answers.question: What do you like best about Shape Software?
review_question_answers.answer:
Prospecting, organization, project management, and reporting is fantastic with Shape.  I've worked on teams where I managed many people under me before, and I still work with an amazing team of people but after properly configuring Shape I'm able to get as much done with just me + Shape's automation as I've been able to do with many assistants before.

Prospecting: We can import massive lists of prospects and we run e-mail text and phone campaigns with all prospects automatically.  We can easily take notes after each contact or contact attempt (I don't even type I just use their voicenote feature) and best of all there are automated e-mails and texts that go out after each contact attempt.  For example after a call if a prospect doesn't answer an automatic e-mail and text is sent out from my system.  There's also a voicemail drop feature which saves us hours, anytime I call and someone doesn't answer I just push a button and a voicemail is left for them.
Organization: My calendar is synced, their mobile app notifies me of everything, and the task management and project management features allow me and everyone to work out of one centralized place.
Reporting: It looks like there are 100+ pre-built reports but I honestly have no idea how many there are (we just use the call reports and email reports, we don't really use the others yet).

My favorite thing, which probably isn't a big deal, is their call recording feature.  Instead of pipeline reports where we used to have to describe what someone sounded like on the phone I can simply just play a recording to hear the candidate speak.

review_question_answers.question: What do you dislike about Shape Software?
review_question_answers.answer: I'm talking to them to see if I can build out some customized features and I'm pretty hopeful I can use their client portal and if that's the case then GEM and other softwares like greenhouse, lever, or Asana may not even be needed in the future and we can just use Shape for those similar features if needed again.

review_question_answers.question: What problems is Shape Software solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer: Sourcing, prospecting, follow-up automation.  I mentioned the call recording feature which I loved and thankfully we didn't even need to purchase Ytel or Ringcentral we just use Shape!

initial_reviews.review_title: Best Mortgage CRM by FAR
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Shape Software?
Best mortgage CRM we've used by far.  We're now looking to use their general CRM for other companies we own (property management, call center, and sales).  They have all the major features we use, and the look and feel is in a different universe vs. other systems we've used.  The LOS integration is great (we used Encompass but now looking to use Lendingpad).  We also use their auto-dialer, e-mail/texts, and a lot of their other general contact management.  We had used Floify before and now we use the Shape Mortgage Client Portal instead.  The benefit there is we can actually nurture leads with e-mail and text marketing, which we couldn't do with Floify before.  We're just starting to build out our online ads with them, excited to see how they perform.

What do you dislike about Shape Software?
Can't think of anything.  Amazing support, we had Stewart and Matt help with our system.

What problems is Shape Software solving and how is that benefiting you?
Consolidated Software - We got rid of 5 software solutions we used to use: Ringcentral, Floify, Dropbox, Mailchimp, and Docusign (Shape has versions of all)
LO/Broker/Sales Automation - We automated e-mails, texts, workflows and a lot of other areas so that the system does it all instead of our people
Communication and Transparency - Our managers are able to have access to information and updates on every lead without having to ask anyone.

initial_reviews.review_title: Shape Is the easiest and most fluid CRM I've ever used.
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Shape Software?
The ease of use of the user interface, which I work out of every day, is effortless in how it's presented; however, it includes loads of functionality that I have complete control over to customize and add automation. One of the prominent features of this CRM is its marketing feature. It allows me to automatically reach out to my clients with pre-built templates that I can customize to my liking. This feature strengthens my relationship with my clients, and I barely even have to lift a finger to utilize this option to the fullest.

What do you dislike about Shape Software?
The only thing i dislike about this software is that setting up the phone system can be a bit complicated as i was utilizing several different area codes to reach multiple clients. However, they have a fantastic support system, and all I had to do was reach out to them, and they got me squared away in no time!

Recommendations to others considering Shape Software:
If you're looking for an easy-to-use CRM with an excellent support team, then this is your product.

What problems is Shape Software solving and how is that benefiting you?
I am consolidating several different software systems that I used to use all under one roof. I have all my client's info, where I can call, text, or email them and start their mortgage application all within the same software. This has benefited me immensely as I don't have to go in and out of different Programs all day just to get something done, which saves me an incredible amount of time every day, allowing me to get on the phone with new clients more quickly.

all_reviews.review_title: Has potential, went another direction
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Shape Software?
Shape appeared to be well designed and had several advanced features like email marketing, lead scoring, and a customer portal. We signed up for 1 month and decided it was not the right fit for us.

What do you dislike about Shape Software?
We often found ourselves knowing more about their product than the Shape sales rep. CRM was not very customizable - you are limited to 20 custom fields and they are hidden in a separate tab. CRM was a little slower than our prior CRM, would take an extra second or two to load. Pricing is also more expensive than some of their competitors and their are several additional costs - storage costs, API costs, etc. Their API is also pretty limiting, both in the functionality it offers and the low daily/hourly rate limits which is surprising considering you have to pay an extra monthly fee to use their API.

What problems is Shape Software solving and how is that benefiting you?
We were looking for a CRM to handle inbound sales leads.

all_reviews.review_title: RIP - OFF WITH HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Shape Software?
cloud based. Nothing really other then centralizing lead info and docs into one convenient portal

What do you dislike about Shape Software?
The company has been billing us month after month for services we did not enable. $300 / mo for google API for maps and $500 / month for call recording. Do not be fooled by their 99/month advertisement. The system will not allow us to remove our credit card info, and they have yet to refund us for fraudulent billing charges that have occurred month after month. They never pick up the phone and bounce you around to different departments via email ONLY. When I emailed my notification of canceling, service was the only time I received a phone call regarding the matter from Daniel Kim in an attempt to retain our account, which is sadly too late. Given the company's evil actions, I am looking to see who else out there has been taken advantage of by Shape. My attorney would like others to step forward so we can build a cohesive case and seek damages for all who are entitled.

Also, any changes, even if it is of the smallest type, have to go through their "engineers," so you have to pay a premium to make any alternations handicapping you and your IT/web development staff.  Please stay away from this company and go with a more established organization.

What problems is Shape Software solving and how is that benefiting you?
Centralizing lead/prospect info with their respective documents is the only real benefit we have experienced; we still pay for a dialer system and store all of the borrowers' documents in the operating loan system.

all_reviews.review_title: 10 out of 10 Prospecting and Contact Management Software
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Shape Software?
Prospecting, organization, project management, and reporting is fantastic with Shape.  I've worked on teams where I managed many people under me before, and I still work with an amazing team of people but after properly configuring Shape I'm able to get as much done with just me + Shape's automation as I've been able to do with many assistants before.

Prospecting: We can import massive lists of prospects and we run e-mail text and phone campaigns with all prospects automatically.  We can easily take notes after each contact or contact attempt (I don't even type I just use their voicenote feature) and best of all there are automated e-mails and texts that go out after each contact attempt.  For example after a call if a prospect doesn't answer an automatic e-mail and text is sent out from my system.  There's also a voicemail drop feature which saves us hours, anytime I call and someone doesn't answer I just push a button and a voicemail is left for them.
Organization: My calendar is synced, their mobile app notifies me of everything, and the task management and project management features allow me and everyone to work out of one centralized place.
Reporting: It looks like there are 100+ pre-built reports but I honestly have no idea how many there are (we just use the call reports and email reports, we don't really use the others yet).

My favorite thing, which probably isn't a big deal, is their call recording feature.  Instead of pipeline reports where we used to have to describe what someone sounded like on the phone I can simply just play a recording to hear the candidate speak.

What do you dislike about Shape Software?
I'm talking to them to see if I can build out some customized features and I'm pretty hopeful I can use their client portal and if that's the case then GEM and other softwares like greenhouse, lever, or Asana may not even be needed in the future and we can just use Shape for those similar features if needed again.

What problems is Shape Software solving and how is that benefiting you?
Sourcing, prospecting, follow-up automation.  I mentioned the call recording feature which I loved and thankfully we didn't even need to purchase Ytel or Ringcentral we just use Shape!

all_reviews.review_title: Best Mortgage CRM by FAR
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Shape Software?
Best mortgage CRM we've used by far.  We're now looking to use their general CRM for other companies we own (property management, call center, and sales).  They have all the major features we use, and the look and feel is in a different universe vs. other systems we've used.  The LOS integration is great (we used Encompass but now looking to use Lendingpad).  We also use their auto-dialer, e-mail/texts, and a lot of their other general contact management.  We had used Floify before and now we use the Shape Mortgage Client Portal instead.  The benefit there is we can actually nurture leads with e-mail and text marketing, which we couldn't do with Floify before.  We're just starting to build out our online ads with them, excited to see how they perform.

What do you dislike about Shape Software?
Can't think of anything.  Amazing support, we had Stewart and Matt help with our system.

What problems is Shape Software solving and how is that benefiting you?
Consolidated Software - We got rid of 5 software solutions we used to use: Ringcentral, Floify, Dropbox, Mailchimp, and Docusign (Shape has versions of all)
LO/Broker/Sales Automation - We automated e-mails, texts, workflows and a lot of other areas so that the system does it all instead of our people
Communication and Transparency - Our managers are able to have access to information and updates on every lead without having to ask anyone.

all_reviews.review_title: Shape Is the easiest and most fluid CRM I've ever used.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Shape Software?
The ease of use of the user interface, which I work out of every day, is effortless in how it's presented; however, it includes loads of functionality that I have complete control over to customize and add automation. One of the prominent features of this CRM is its marketing feature. It allows me to automatically reach out to my clients with pre-built templates that I can customize to my liking. This feature strengthens my relationship with my clients, and I barely even have to lift a finger to utilize this option to the fullest.

What do you dislike about Shape Software?
The only thing i dislike about this software is that setting up the phone system can be a bit complicated as i was utilizing several different area codes to reach multiple clients. However, they have a fantastic support system, and all I had to do was reach out to them, and they got me squared away in no time!

Recommendations to others considering Shape Software:
If you're looking for an easy-to-use CRM with an excellent support team, then this is your product.

What problems is Shape Software solving and how is that benefiting you?
I am consolidating several different software systems that I used to use all under one roof. I have all my client's info, where I can call, text, or email them and start their mortgage application all within the same software. This has benefited me immensely as I don't have to go in and out of different Programs all day just to get something done, which saves me an incredible amount of time every day, allowing me to get on the phone with new clients more quickly.

On the top left, there's the productivity sidebar where we can add important notes, and get communication details like SMS, email, or phone calls. If you need to call your customer, you need to hover on their phone number and click to call. Similarly, the email can be sent in a similar way, and also there are email templates saved by default to ease up your entire process.

Documentation is needed for a new user. It is difficult to learn and get used to the software without the help of documentation.

all_reviews.review_title: Easiest and most effective "all in one" platform I've ever used
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Shape Software?
My personal favorite thing about Shape is that it is the most effective platform I've ever used for a one-stop-shop for everything I've needed. One of my favorite features is the SMS integration. As a lot of my business is conducted via text, it makes it extremely easy for me to see all my texts right there on the software. Another one of my favorite features is the MLS sync which lets me find particular listings that match my criteria, all right there in the software! As well, being able to easily prioritize leads easily within the software is another plus. Overall, just the ability to sync and integrate practically everything you could possibly think of into one area makes this software so valuable. Not having multiple tabs or apps open on my computer or phone and being able to manage basically all components from one spot has definitely been worth the cost of the Shape. Also, I've been using google calendar for ages and basically all my business-oriented events are scheduled on there for the next several months, so being able to seamlessly integrate my google calendar into Shape is just another plus!

What do you dislike about Shape Software?
Perhaps I'd like to edit the style of the software a little bit. Having more customization in terms of the aesthetic of Shape would be nice.

Recommendations to others considering Shape Software:
If you are managing your business through using several apps and Softwares, this will definitely make your life much easier

What problems is Shape Software solving and how is that benefiting you?
One of my main problems prior to having Shape was having to jumble and navigate from software to software for my various work-related documents and files. Being able to seamlessly manage literally everything from one central place has made life definitely easier, and in the long run, looking at the $100 price tag, it is most certainly worth it.

all_reviews.review_title: A software that can do it all!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Shape Software?
I was able to ditch my confusing excel spreadsheet, extensive email inbox labeling, and manual tracking system with one easy-to-use software. Shape Software provides the automation I need to focus more time on the digital marketing services I provide, and less time managing the administrative side of my own business. The automated features were the biggest selling points for me! Lead capture, sending follow-ups, and managing ongoing client projects within one interface has streamlined my entire process. I no longer lose track of important information or have to update the same client status in multiple locations. And, the automation has taken the tedious and time-consuming tasks off of my to-do list!

What do you dislike about Shape Software?
I am a fairly new user to Shape Software, but will definitely be continuing! As of now, there are few items I dislike. It is much easier to use than past CRM Softwares and plugins I have tried. The intuitiveness is essential for me. Sometimes it takes a while to load, but I don't have incredible internet access where I live, so that could be a factor too.

What problems is Shape Software solving and how is that benefiting you?
My biggest thing is organization and time-saving. The automated lead capture and follow-ups have freed up an enormous chunk of my time that I can focus on current client projects and delivering exemplary service. I can now see the areas I actually need help in and where to devote the time to growing my business. The administrative confusion was distracting me from seeing the potential of my business!
